政を執る: (まつりごとをとる) - to administer the affairs of state
政争の具とする: (せいそうのぐとする) - to make a political issue of (something)
政争の渦: (せいそうのうず) - whirlpool of political strife
政令: (せいれい) - government ordinance; cabinet order
政令指定都市: (せいれいしていとし) - ordinance-designated city
政体: (せいたい) - form of government; system of government; polity
政倫審: (せいりんしん) - Deliberative Council on Political Ethics (Diet Committee); ethics committee
政党交付金: (せいとうこうふきん) - public funding for political parties; party subsidy
政党内閣: (せいとうないかく) - party cabinet
政党員: (せいとういん) - member of a political party
政冷経熱: (せいれいけいねつ) - cold political relations but hot economical relations (often said about China-Japan relations)
政労: (せいろう) - government-labour (e.g. liaison meeting); government-labor
政務を執る: (せいむをとる) - to administer affairs of state; to attend to government affairs
政務を見る: (せいむをみる) - to administer affairs of state; to attend to government affairs
政務三役: (せいむさんやく) - three highest ranks in a ministry: minister, vice minister and parliamentary secretary
政商: (せいしょう) - businessman with political ties
政変: (せいへん) - political disturbance; political change; coup d'état; coup; revolution; overthrowing of a government (e.g. Jasmine Revolution)
政客: (せいきゃく) - politician (or someone otherwise engaged in politics); statesman
政府介入: (せいふかいにゅう) - government intervention
政府保証債: (せいふほしょうさい) - government-guaranteed bond
政府出資: (せいふしゅっし) - government funding; government-financed
政府所有: (せいふしょゆう) - gov't property; gov't owned
政府機関: (せいふきかん) - government body; government agency
政府短期証券: (せいふたんきしょうけん) - financing bill; FB
政府筋: (せいふすじ) - government sources; official quarters
政府管掌保険: (せいふかんしょうほけん) - government-managed insurance
政府管掌健康保険: (せいふかんしょうけんこうほけん) - government-managed health insurance
政府開発援助: (せいふかいはつえんじょ) - Official Development Assistance; ODA
政情: (せいじょう) - political situation; political affairs
政情不安: (せいじょうふあん) - (yoji) the instability of a political situation; political instability
政所: (まつりごとどころ) - official in charge of the administration of domains and general affairs of powerful noble families (from the middle of the Heian period); titled lady (legal wife of an important official); government office related to finances (Kamakura and Muromachi periods); clerk working for large temples and shrines
政教: (せいきょう) - religion and politics; church and state
政教一致: (せいきょういっち) - (yoji) unity of church and state
政教分離: (せいきょうぶんり) - (yoji) separation of church and state
政権を握る: (せいけんをにぎる) - to come to power; to assume the reins of government
政権下: (せいけんか) - (often 政権下で) under the ... administration; within the ... government
政権争い: (せいけんあらそい) - political power struggle
政権亡者: (せいけんもうじゃ) - (yoji) one who is obsessed with (getting into, holding on to) political power; one who is obsessed with the idea of taking over government
政権交代: (せいけんこうたい) - (yoji) change of government; regime change
政権党: (せいけんとう) - political party in power
政権公約: (せいけんこうやく) - policy statement; manifesto
政権構想: (せいけんこうそう) - (yoji) planning a new government; plan for a new administration
政権運営: (せいけんうんえい) - running a government administration; managing a cabinet
政治パーティー: (せいじパーティー) - political fundraiser
政治不信: (せいじふしん) - (yoji) distrust of politics; political uncertainty
政治主導: (せいじしゅどう) - (yoji) initiative taken by politicians (in the formulation of a policy or bill) (rather than by bureaucrats)
政治亡命: (せいじぼうめい) - political asylum; political exile
政治交渉: (せいじこうしょう) - political negotiation
政治倫理審査会: (せいじりんりしんさかい) - Deliberative Council on Political Ethics
政治制度: (せいじせいど) - political system; political institution; regime
政治力学: (せいじりきがく) - (yoji) political dynamics; dynamics of political forces; the balance of political power
政治団体: (せいじだんたい) - a political organization; a political organisation
政治家肌: (せいじかはだ) - (yoji) being something of a politician; having something of the politician in one
政治屋: (せいじや) - politician (esp. one who works only for their own personal gain)
政治工作: (せいじこうさく) - (yoji) political maneuvering; politicking; political machinations
政治干渉: (せいじかんしょう) - political intervention
政治思想: (せいじしそう) - political thought; political philosophy; political idea; idea about politics
